Package com.ibm.security.verifysdk

The IBM Security Verify SDK provides the classes necessary to create applications that interact with IBM Security Verify and IBM Security Verify Access.

The following sections will guide you through finding out how the SDK works, what functionality it provides, and how this functionality can be incorporated into your own projects.

The IBM Security Verify SDK provides programmatic access to IBM Security related technologies through REST API endpoints. Apps can use the IBM Security Verify SDK to build rich native client mobile applications that handle the authentication operations for cloud-based and on-premise deployments.

The IBM Security Verify SDK includes a set of authentication challenge mechanisms to enable application developers to respond to multi-factor authentication (MFA) events triggered from server-side policy logic. The IBM Security Verify SDK also is extensible so that developers can create their own MFA based challenges and handle the client interaction.

In addition the IBM Security Verify SDK enables developers to build "white-label" applications for their own one-time password generation. Embedded into the API are counter (HOTP) and time-based (TOTP) generators that work seamless with IBM Security Verify Access secret key registration process.

A key design of the IBM Security Verify SDK is a consistent API across iOS and Android whilst being faithful to language syntax of each of the platforms.

Since:
2.0.0
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    IAuthenticationMethod
    Provides the base model interface for authentication methods that will be used in CloudAuthenticator and OnPremiseAuthenticator for availableMethods and enrolledMethods.
    IAuthenticator
    Provides the base model interface for an object implements to distinguish OTP from MFA authenticators.
    IMfaAuthenticator
    Provides the base model interface for an object implements to distinguish on-premise from cloud network operations.
    IQRScanResult
    Provides the base model interface for an object implements to distinguish scanned QR codes.
    IResultCallback<T>
    Provides the base model interface for a result callback handler that includes a VerifySdkException object.
    ITransactionResultCallback
    Provides the base model interface for a transaction result callback handler that includes a PendingTransaction, the number of transactions in the queue and a VerifySdkException object.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AuthenticationMethod
    Provides an abstract class to hold the attributes of an authentication method.
    AuthenticatorContext
    A singleton class that represents an authenticator context for mobile applications to register a device against IBM Security Cloud and IBM Security Verify Access.
    CloudAuthenticator
    This class holds the attributes for an authenticator for IBM Security Verify.
    CloudQRLoginScan
    Handles the parsing of a cloud-based QR code for a password-less authentication.
    CloudQRScan
    Handles the parsing of a QR code for cloud device registration.
    ContextHelper
    A singleton class to provide SDK wide access to the Context of the application, without the need to pass it to every other class that needs it.
    HotpGeneratorContext
    Implementation to calculate a hash-based one-time password according to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4226
    KeyStoreHelper
    Helper class to perform key management and signing operations.
    LoginQrScan Deprecated.
    Class is deprecated because of required differentiation between OnPremise and Cloud QR code login.
    NetworkHandler
    A singleton class that configures the network objects that handles the calls.
    OAuthContext
    A singleton class that implements the Resource Owner Password Credentials (ROPC) Grant and Authorization Code Grant as the calling client to an OAuth authorization server.
    OAuthToken
    Handles the access token and optional refresh token for requests to protected resources.
    OnPremiseAuthenticator
    This class holds the attributes for an authenticator for IBM Security Verify Access.
    OnPremiseQRLoginScan
    Handles the parsing of an On-Premise QR code for a password-less authentication.
    OnPremiseQRScan
    Handles the parsing of a QR code for on-premises device registration.
    OtpAuthenticator
    An authenticator for a one-time password (OTP).
    OtpGeneratorContext
    Implements an abstract class for TotpGeneratorContext and HotpGeneratorContext according to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4226 and https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6238
    OtpQRScan
    Handles the parsing of a QR code for one-time password (OTP) data.
    PendingTransaction
    This class holds the attributes for a pending transaction.
    SignatureAuthenticationMethod
    This class holds the attributes for a signature based enrollment structure.
    TotpAuthenticationMethod
    This class holds the attributes for a time based one-time password (TOTP) based enrollment.
    TotpGeneratorContext
    Implementation to calculate a time-based one-time password according to https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6238
    UIQRScanView
    The UIQRScanView enables mobile application to scan a QR code for device registration.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Algorithm
    The enumerated type that provides access to supported algorithms and matches their names to the Android Keystore as described in https://developer.android.com/training/articles/keystore#SupportedSignatures
    ErrorCode
    The enumerated error type that provides constant values of error codes.
    HmacAlgorithm
    The enumerated type that provides access to a number of HMAC algorithms.
    MethodType
    The enumerated type that provides constant values of specific method type of an AuthenticationMethod instance.
    OtpAuthenticator.OtpType
    The type of one-time password.
    PendingTransaction.TransactionAttribute
    The enumerated type that defines extended transaction attributes.
    RegistrationAttributes
    The enumerated type that provides constant values of the registration attributes.
    SubType
    The enumerated type that provides constant values of specific sub type of an AuthenticationMethod instance.
    UserAction
    The enumerated type of user actions that can be performed on a transaction.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    VerifySdkException
    The customized exception class.
